head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: Arrest In Rape Of Student

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: Arrest In Rape Of Student

body.head.byline: By AL BAKER; Compiled by Thomas J. Lueck

abstract.p: Ivory Gordon is charged with sexually assaulting teenage girl attending New Beginnings School in New York City; Gordon was employed at Madison Square Boys and Girls Club, which coordinates programs with school (S)

block.p: A man who works at an organization that collaborates with a school in Brooklyn was charged yesterday with sexually assaulting a teenage student, city school officials said. The man, Ivory Gordon, 24, of Brooklyn, was charged with rape, sex abuse and criminal sexual conduct, according to the office of Richard J. Condon, the special commissioner of investigation for the city schools. The student, a girl attending the New Beginnings School, was assaulted several times on school premises and at Mr. Gordon's home, according to Mr. Condon's office. Mr. Gordon was suspended without pay on Monday from his job as a case manager at the Madison Square Boys and Girls Club's Navy Yard clubhouse, said Joseph Patuleia, the organization's executive director. He said the city ran New Beginnings in the clubhouse under a contract.
